description: As a D&B Onboard user I want my Compliance Report to display important company information so that I can identify the company as I investigate the company
name: Reports - Sources Tab - ECF countries

elements.name: TC1: Verify the correct information is in the Sources Tab for a UK report

steps.name: a Logged On Onboard user goes to the "Landing Page".
the user performs an advanced search using the following criteria:
"1" company are displayed in the results.
the user clicks the Buy Report button for the company in position "1".
the ECF summary sidebar is visible.
the user clicks on the Sources link.
an overall heading says the following:

cells: D&B receives and collates data from hundreds of sources across the world. Below are details of where our data is procured from, how information is gathered and when it is updated, based on the country this entity is located in. Other sources may also have been used and our providers are subject to change.

steps.name: the Primary Data Sources heading saying "Primary data sources used in this country are:" is visible.

arguments.val: Primary data sources used in this country are:

steps.name: the following Primary Data Sources are displayed:
the Data Elements heading saying "The data elements from this source include:" is visible.

arguments.val: The data elements from this source include:

steps.name: the following Data elements are displayed:

cells: Business Name, Telephone, Fax, SIC, Start Date, Employee Figure, URL, Email, Exec
Business Name, Telephone, Fax, SIC, Employee Figure, URL, Email, Exec

steps.name: the Frequencies heading saying "The frequency of the updates are:" is visible.

arguments.val: The frequency of the updates are:

steps.name: the following Frequencies are displayed:
the How Received heading is visible and contains the following:

cells: How received (direct feed, keyed manually etc)

steps.name: the following Received methods are displayed:
the Standard Filing Requirements heading saying "Standard filing requirements are:" is visible.

arguments.val: Standard filing requirements are:

steps.name: a Required to File subheading saying "Required to File" is visible.

arguments.val: Required to File

steps.name: the following requirements are displayed:
a Not Required to File subheading saying "Not Required to File" is visible.

arguments.val: Not Required to File

steps.name: the following non-requirements are displayed:

elements.name: TC2: Verify the correct information is in the Sources Tab for a report from a country which we do not have sources data

steps.name: a Logged On Onboard user goes to the "Landing Page".
the user performs an advanced search using the following criteria:
"1" company are displayed in the results.
the user clicks the Buy Report button for the company in position "1".
the ECF summary sidebar is visible.
the user clicks on the Sources link.
an overall heading says the following:

cells: Currently, we do not have up to date information on all source data from our teams in this country. We are constantly finding and integrating new data sources and updating our records accordingly across the globe. We will provide information on this particular county as soon as possible. For further information please contact our customer services team.

steps.name: the Primary Data Sources heading is not visible.
the Data Elements heading is not visible.
the Frequencies heading is not visible.
the How Received heading is not visible.
the Standard Filing Requirements heading is not visible.

the user performs an advanced search using the following criteria:

an overall heading says the following:

cells: D&B receives and collates data from hundreds of sources across the world. steps.name: the Primary Data Sources heading saying "Primary data sources used in this country are:" is visible.

arguments.val: Primary data sources used in this country are:

steps.name: the following Primary Data Sources are displayed:
the Data Elements heading saying "The data elements from this source include:" is visible.

arguments.val: The data elements from this source include:

steps.name: the following Data elements are displayed:

cells: Company ID data, Name, Address, Principals, Activity, Legal Form, Employees, Contact Details, Branches, Tribunal Court Judgements, Financial Strength, Legal Procedures, Company Status, Employee Number, Tradestyles
Special Events (e.g. Merger/Acquisitions, Bankruptcies, Fires, Strikes)
Both official and unoffical data: addresses, name, VAT number, tradestyles, directors, bank contacts, telephones, import and export details, linkages, premises, sales type

steps.name: the Frequencies heading saying "The frequency of the updates are:" is visible.

arguments.val: The frequency of the updates are:

steps.name: the following Frequencies are displayed:

cells: Weekly Updates and Cancellations New Filings every 2 weeks

steps.name: the How Received heading is visible and contains the following:

cells: How received (direct feed, keyed manually etc)

steps.name: the following Received methods are displayed:

cells: Electronic feed from chamber of commerce (positions need to be identified and requested)
Electronic feed from chamber of commerce
Electronic feed from chamber of commerce (Updates, Cancellations) - CD from Chamber of Commerce (New Filings) - New filings need matching
Electronic feed from chamber of commerce (positions with changes of ownership are notified, but must be matched)
Electronic feed (positions with changes of ownership are notified, but must be matched)
Trade files (electronic format) from trade particiapnts - to be matched and processed
Manual Update to Database (after manual matching)
Electronic Feed from Supplier - needs matching

arguments.val: Required to File

cells: Public Ltd, Limited Liability, Partnership limited by shares, Cooperative, Consortium, Stock Limited Partnerships, GEIE

steps.name: a Not Required to File subheading saying "Not Required to File" is visible.

arguments.val: Not Required to File
